02535     strcpy(tmp, linea->line);
02536     strcat(tmp, lineb->line);
02537 
02538     make_new_line(linea, tmp);
02539     
02540     txt_delete_line(text, lineb);
02541     
02542     txt_make_dirty(text);
02543     txt_clean_text(text);
02544 }
02545 
02546 void txt_delete_char(Text *text) 
02547 {
02548     unsigned int c='\n';
02549     
02550     if (!text) return;
02551     if (!text->curl) return;
02552 
02553     if (txt_has_sel(text)) { /* deleting a selection */
02554         txt_delete_sel(text);
02555         txt_make_dirty(text);
02556         return;
02557     }
02558     else if (text->curc== text->curl->len) { /* Appending two lines */
02559         if (text->curl->next) {
02560             txt_combine_lines(text, text->curl, text->curl->next);
02561             txt_pop_sel(text);
02562         }
02563         else
02564             return;
02565     }
02566     else { /* Just deleting a char */
02567         size_t c_len = 0;
02568         TextMarker *mrk;
02569         c= BLI_str_utf8_as_unicode_and_size(text->curl->line + text->curc, &c_len);
02570 
02571         mrk= txt_find_marker_region(text, text->curl, text->curc - c_len, text->curl->len, 0, 0);
02572         if (mrk) {
02573             int lineno= mrk->lineno;
02574             if (mrk->end==text->curc) {
02575                 if ((mrk->flags & TMARK_TEMP) && !(mrk->flags & TMARK_EDITALL)) {
02576                     txt_clear_markers(text, mrk->group, TMARK_TEMP);
02577                 }
02578                 else {
02579                     BLI_freelinkN(&text->markers, mrk);
02580                 }
02581                 return;
02582             }
02583             do {
02584                 if (mrk->start>text->curc) mrk->start-= c_len;
02585                 mrk->end-= c_len;
02586                 mrk= mrk->next;
02587             } while (mrk && mrk->lineno==lineno);
02588         }
02589         
02590         memmove(text->curl->line+text->curc, text->curl->line+text->curc+c_len, text->curl->len-text->curc-c_len+1);
02591 
02592         text->curl->len-= c_len;
02593 
02594         txt_pop_sel(text);
02595     }
02596 
02597     txt_make_dirty(text);
02598     txt_clean_text(text);
02599     
02600     if (!undoing) txt_undo_add_charop(text, UNDO_DEL_1, c);
02601 }
02602 
02603 void txt_delete_word (Text *text) 
02604 {
02605     txt_jump_right(text, 1);
02606     txt_delete_sel(text);
02607 }
02608 
02609 void txt_backspace_char (Text *text) 
02610 {
02611     unsigned int c='\n';
02612     
02613     if (!text) return;
02614     if (!text->curl) return;
02615     
02616     if (txt_has_sel(text)) { /* deleting a selection */
02617         txt_delete_sel(text);
02618         txt_make_dirty(text);
02619         return;
02620     }
02621     else if (text->curc==0) { /* Appending two lines */
02622         if (!text->curl->prev) return;
02623         
02624         text->curl= text->curl->prev;
02625         text->curc= text->curl->len;
02626         
02627         txt_combine_lines(text, text->curl, text->curl->next);
02628         txt_pop_sel(text);
02629     }
02630     else { /* Just backspacing a char */
02631         size_t c_len = 0;
02632         TextMarker *mrk;
02633         char *prev = BLI_str_prev_char_utf8(text->curl->line + text->curc);
02634         c= BLI_str_utf8_as_unicode_and_size(prev, &c_len);
02635 
02636         mrk= txt_find_marker_region(text, text->curl, text->curc - c_len, text->curl->len, 0, 0);
02637         if (mrk) {
02638             int lineno= mrk->lineno;
02639             if (mrk->start==text->curc) {
02640                 if ((mrk->flags & TMARK_TEMP) && !(mrk->flags & TMARK_EDITALL)) {
02641                     txt_clear_markers(text, mrk->group, TMARK_TEMP);
02642                 }
02643                 else {
02644                     BLI_freelinkN(&text->markers, mrk);
02645                 }
02646                 return;
02647             }
02648             do {
02649                 if (mrk->start>text->curc - c_len) mrk->start-= c_len;
02650                 mrk->end-= c_len;
02651                 mrk= mrk->next;
02652             } while (mrk && mrk->lineno==lineno);
02653         }
02654         
02655         /* source and destination overlap, don't use memcpy() */
02656         memmove(text->curl->line + text->curc - c_len,
02657                 text->curl->line + text->curc,
02658                 text->curl->len  - text->curc + 1);
02659 
02660         text->curl->len-= c_len;
02661         text->curc-= c_len;
02662 
02663         txt_pop_sel(text);
02664     }
02665 
02666     txt_make_dirty(text);
02667     txt_clean_text(text);
02668     
02669     if (!undoing) txt_undo_add_charop(text, UNDO_BS_1, c);
02670 }
02671 
02672 void txt_backspace_word (Text *text) 
02673 {
02674     txt_jump_left(text, 1);
02675     txt_delete_sel(text);
02676 }
02677 
02678 /* Max spaces to replace a tab with, currently hardcoded to TXT_TABSIZE = 4.
02679  * Used by txt_convert_tab_to_spaces, indent and unindent.
02680  * Remember to change this string according to max tab size */
02681 static char tab_to_spaces[] = "    ";
02682 
02683 static void txt_convert_tab_to_spaces (Text *text)
02684 {
02685     /* sb aims to pad adjust the tab-width needed so that the right number of spaces
02686      * is added so that the indention of the line is the right width (i.e. aligned
02687      * to multiples of TXT_TABSIZE)
02688      */
02689     char *sb = &tab_to_spaces[text->curc % TXT_TABSIZE];
02690     txt_insert_buf(text, sb);
02691 }
02692 
02693 static int txt_add_char_intern (Text *text, unsigned int add, int replace_tabs)
02694 {
02695     int lineno;
02696     char *tmp, ch[BLI_UTF8_MAX];
02697     TextMarker *mrk;
02698     size_t add_len;
02699     
02700     if (!text) return 0;
02701     if (!text->curl) return 0;
02702 
02703     if (add=='\n') {
02704         txt_split_curline(text);
02705         return 1;
02706     }
02707     
02708     /* insert spaces rather than tabs */
02709     if (add == '\t' && replace_tabs) {
02710         txt_convert_tab_to_spaces(text);
02711         return 1;
02712     }
02713 
02714     txt_delete_sel(text);
02715     
02716     add_len = BLI_str_utf8_from_unicode(add, ch);
02717     mrk= txt_find_marker_region(text, text->curl, text->curc-1, text->curl->len, 0, 0);
02718     if (mrk) {
02719         lineno= mrk->lineno;
02720         do {
02721             if (mrk->start>text->curc) mrk->start+= add_len;
02722             mrk->end+= add_len;
02723             mrk= mrk->next;
02724         } while (mrk && mrk->lineno==lineno);
02725     }
02726     
02727     tmp= MEM_mallocN(text->curl->len+add_len+1, "textline_string");
02728     
02729     memcpy(tmp, text->curl->line, text->curc);
02730     memcpy(tmp+text->curc, ch, add_len);
02731     memcpy(tmp+text->curc+add_len, text->curl->line+text->curc, text->curl->len-text->curc+1);
02732 
02733     make_new_line(text->curl, tmp);
02734         
02735     text->curc+= add_len;
02736 
02737     txt_pop_sel(text);
02738     
02739     txt_make_dirty(text);
02740     txt_clean_text(text);
02741 
02742     if (!undoing) txt_undo_add_charop(text, UNDO_INSERT_1, add);
02743     return 1;
02744 }
02745 
02746 int txt_add_char (Text *text, unsigned int add)
02747 {
02748     return txt_add_char_intern(text, add, text->flags & TXT_TABSTOSPACES);
02749 }
02750 
02751 int txt_add_raw_char (Text *text, unsigned int add)
02752 {
02753     return txt_add_char_intern(text, add, 0);
02754 }
02755 
02756 void txt_delete_selected(Text *text)
02757 {
02758     txt_delete_sel(text);
02759     txt_make_dirty(text);
02760 }
02761 
02762 int txt_replace_char (Text *text, unsigned int add)
02763 {
02764     unsigned int del;
02765     size_t del_size = 0, add_size;
02766     char ch[BLI_UTF8_MAX];
02767     
02768     if (!text) return 0;
02769     if (!text->curl) return 0;
02770 
02771     /* If text is selected or we're at the end of the line just use txt_add_char */
02772     if (text->curc==text->curl->len || txt_has_sel(text) || add=='\n') {
02773         int i= txt_add_char(text, add);
02774         TextMarker *mrk= txt_find_marker(text, text->curl, text->curc, 0, 0);
02775         if (mrk) BLI_freelinkN(&text->markers, mrk);
02776         return i;
02777     }
02778     
02779     del= BLI_str_utf8_as_unicode_and_size(text->curl->line + text->curc, &del_size);
02780     add_size= BLI_str_utf8_from_unicode(add, ch);
02781     
02782     if (add_size > del_size) {
02783         char *tmp= MEM_mallocN(text->curl->len+add_size-del_size+1, "textline_string");
02784         memcpy(tmp, text->curl->line, text->curc);
02785         memcpy(tmp+text->curc+add_size, text->curl->line+text->curc+del_size, text->curl->len-text->curc-del_size+1);
02786         MEM_freeN(text->curl->line);
02787         text->curl->line = tmp;
02788     }
02789     else if (add_size < del_size) {
02790         char *tmp= text->curl->line;
02791         memmove(tmp+text->curc+add_size, tmp+text->curc+del_size, text->curl->len-text->curc-del_size+1);
02792     }
02793     
02794     memcpy(text->curl->line + text->curc, ch, add_size);
02795     text->curc+= add_size;
02796     
02797     txt_pop_sel(text);
02798     txt_make_dirty(text);
02799     txt_clean_text(text);
02800 
02801     /* Should probably create a new op for this */
02802     if (!undoing) {
02803         txt_undo_add_charop(text, UNDO_DEL_1, del);
02804         txt_undo_add_charop(text, UNDO_INSERT_1, add);
02805     }
02806     return 1;
02807 }
02808 
02809 void txt_indent(Text *text)
02810 {
02811     int len, num;
02812     char *tmp;
02813 
02814     const char *add = "\t";
02815     int indentlen = 1;
02816     
02817     /* hardcoded: TXT_TABSIZE = 4 spaces: */
02818     int spaceslen = TXT_TABSIZE;
02819 
02820     if (ELEM3(NULL, text, text->curl, text->sell)) {
02821         return;
02822     }
02823 
02824     if (!text) return;
02825     if (!text->curl) return;
02826     if (!text->sell) return;
02827 
02828     /* insert spaces rather than tabs */
02829     if (text->flags & TXT_TABSTOSPACES) {
02830         add = tab_to_spaces;
02831         indentlen = spaceslen;
02832     }
02833 
02834     num = 0;
02835     while (TRUE)
02836     {
02837         tmp= MEM_mallocN(text->curl->len+indentlen+1, "textline_string");
02838         
02839         text->curc = 0; 
02840         if (text->curc) memcpy(tmp, text->curl->line, text->curc); /* XXX never true, check prev line */
02841         memcpy(tmp+text->curc, add, indentlen);
02842         
02843         len= text->curl->len - text->curc;
02844         if (len>0) memcpy(tmp+text->curc+indentlen, text->curl->line+text->curc, len);
02845         tmp[text->curl->len+indentlen]= 0;
02846 
02847         make_new_line(text->curl, tmp);
02848             
02849         text->curc+= indentlen;
02850         
02851         txt_make_dirty(text);
02852         txt_clean_text(text);
02853         
02854         if (text->curl == text->sell) 
02855         {
02856             text->selc = text->sell->len;
02857             break;
02858         }
02859         else {
02860             text->curl = text->curl->next;
02861             num++;
02862         }
02863     }
02864     text->curc = 0;
02865     while ( num > 0 )
02866     {
02867         text->curl = text->curl->prev;
02868         num--;
02869     }
02870     
02871     if (!undoing) 
02872     {
02873         txt_undo_add_toop(text, UNDO_INDENT, txt_get_span(text->lines.first, text->curl), text->curc, txt_get_span(text->lines.first, text->sell), text->selc);
02874     }
02875 }
02876 
02877 void txt_unindent(Text *text)
02878 {
02879     int num = 0;
02880     const char *remove = "\t";
02881     int indent = 1;
02882     
02883     /* hardcoded: TXT_TABSIZE = 4 spaces: */
02884     int spaceslen = TXT_TABSIZE;
02885 
02886     if (!text) return;
02887     if (!text->curl) return;
02888     if (!text->sell) return;
02889 
02890     /* insert spaces rather than tabs */
02891     if (text->flags & TXT_TABSTOSPACES) {
02892         remove = tab_to_spaces;
02893         indent = spaceslen;
02894     }
02895 
02896     while (TRUE)
02897     {
02898         int i = 0;
02899         
02900         if (BLI_strncasecmp(text->curl->line, remove, indent) == 0)
02901         {
02902             while (i< text->curl->len) {
02903                 text->curl->line[i]= text->curl->line[i+indent];
02904                 i++;
02905             }
02906             text->curl->len-= indent;
02907         }
02908     
02909         txt_make_dirty(text);
02910         txt_clean_text(text);
02911         
02912         if (text->curl == text->sell) 
02913         {
02914             text->selc = text->sell->len;
02915             break;
02916         }
02917         else {
02918             text->curl = text->curl->next;
02919             num++;
02920         }
02921         
02922     }
02923     text->curc = 0;
02924     while ( num > 0 )
02925     {
02926         text->curl = text->curl->prev;
02927         num--;
02928     }
02929     
02930     if (!undoing) 
02931     {
02932         txt_undo_add_toop(text, UNDO_UNINDENT, txt_get_span(text->lines.first, text->curl), text->curc, txt_get_span(text->lines.first, text->sell), text->selc);
02933     }
02934 }
02935 
02936 void txt_comment(Text *text)
02937 {
02938     int len, num;
02939     char *tmp;
02940     char add = '#';
02941     
02942     if (!text) return;
02943     if (!text->curl) return;
02944     if (!text->sell) return;// Need to change this need to check if only one line is selected to more then one
02945 
02946     num = 0;
02947     while (TRUE)
02948     {
02949         tmp= MEM_mallocN(text->curl->len+2, "textline_string");
02950         
02951         text->curc = 0; 
02952         if (text->curc) memcpy(tmp, text->curl->line, text->curc);
02953         tmp[text->curc]= add;
02954         
02955         len= text->curl->len - text->curc;
02956         if (len>0) memcpy(tmp+text->curc+1, text->curl->line+text->curc, len);
02957         tmp[text->curl->len+1]=0;
02958 
02959         make_new_line(text->curl, tmp);
02960             
02961         text->curc++;
02962         
02963         txt_make_dirty(text);
02964         txt_clean_text(text);
02965         
02966         if (text->curl == text->sell) 
02967         {
02968             text->selc = text->sell->len;
02969             break;
02970         }
02971         else {
02972             text->curl = text->curl->next;
02973             num++;
02974         }
02975     }
02976     text->curc = 0;
02977     while ( num > 0 )
02978     {
02979         text->curl = text->curl->prev;
02980         num--;
02981     }
02982     
02983     if (!undoing) 
02984     {
02985         txt_undo_add_toop(text, UNDO_COMMENT, txt_get_span(text->lines.first, text->curl), text->curc, txt_get_span(text->lines.first, text->sell), text->selc);
02986     }
02987 }
02988 
02989 void txt_uncomment(Text *text)
02990 {
02991     int num = 0;
02992     char remove = '#';
02993     
02994     if (!text) return;
02995     if (!text->curl) return;
02996     if (!text->sell) return;
02997 
02998     while (TRUE)
02999     {
03000         int i = 0;
03001         
03002         if (text->curl->line[i] == remove)
03003         {
03004             while (i< text->curl->len) {
03005                 text->curl->line[i]= text->curl->line[i+1];
03006                 i++;
03007             }
03008             text->curl->len--;
03009         }
03010              
03011     
03012         txt_make_dirty(text);
03013         txt_clean_text(text);
03014         
03015         if (text->curl == text->sell) 
03016         {
03017             text->selc = text->sell->len;
03018             break;
03019         }
03020         else {
03021             text->curl = text->curl->next;
03022             num++;
03023         }
03024         
03025     }
03026     text->curc = 0;
03027     while ( num > 0 )
03028     {
03029         text->curl = text->curl->prev;
03030         num--;
03031     }
03032     
03033     if (!undoing) 
03034     {
03035         txt_undo_add_toop(text, UNDO_UNCOMMENT, txt_get_span(text->lines.first, text->curl), text->curc, txt_get_span(text->lines.first, text->sell), text->selc);
03036     }
03037 }
03038 
03039 int setcurr_tab_spaces (Text *text, int space)
03040 {
03041     int i = 0;
03042     int test = 0;
03043     const char *word = ":";
03044     const char *comm = "#";
03045     const char indent= (text->flags & TXT_TABSTOSPACES) ? ' ' : '\t';
03046     static const char *back_words[]= {"return", "break", "continue", "pass", "yield", NULL};
03047     if (!text) return 0;
03048     if (!text->curl) return 0;
03049 
03050     while (text->curl->line[i] == indent)
03051     {
03052         //we only count those tabs/spaces that are before any text or before the curs;
03053         if (i == text->curc)
03054         {
03055             return i;
03056         }
03057         else {
03058             i++;
03059         }
03060     }
03061     if (strstr(text->curl->line, word))
03062     {
03063         /* if we find a ':' on this line, then add a tab but not if it is:
03064          *  1) in a comment
03065          *  2) within an identifier
03066          *  3) after the cursor (text->curc), i.e. when creating space before a function def [#25414] 
03067          */
03068         int a, is_indent = 0;
03069         for (a=0; (a < text->curc) && (text->curl->line[a] != '\0'); a++)
03070         {
03071             char ch= text->curl->line[a];
03072             if (ch=='#') {
03073                 break;
03074             }
03075             else if (ch==':') {
03076                 is_indent = 1;
03077             }
03078             else if (ch!=' ' && ch!='\t') {
03079                 is_indent = 0;
03080             }
03081         }
03082         if (is_indent) {
03083             i += space;
03084         }
03085     }
03086 
03087     for (test=0; back_words[test]; test++)
03088     {
03089         /* if there are these key words then remove a tab because we are done with the block */
03090         if (strstr(text->curl->line, back_words[test]) && i > 0)
03091         {
03092             if (strcspn(text->curl->line, back_words[test]) < strcspn(text->curl->line, comm))
03093             {
03094                 i -= space;
03095             }
03096         }
03097     }
03098     return i;
03099 }
03100 
03101 /*********************************/
03102 /* Text marker utility functions */
03103 /*********************************/
03104 
03105 /* Creates and adds a marker to the list maintaining sorted order */
03106 void txt_add_marker(Text *text, TextLine *line, int start, int end, const unsigned char color[4], int group, int flags)
03107 {
03108     TextMarker *tmp, *marker;
03109 
03110     marker= MEM_mallocN(sizeof(TextMarker), "text_marker");
03111     
03112     marker->lineno= txt_get_span(text->lines.first, line);
03113     marker->start= MIN2(start, end);
03114     marker->end= MAX2(start, end);
03115     marker->group= group;
03116     marker->flags= flags;
03117 
03118     marker->color[0]= color[0];
03119     marker->color[1]= color[1];
03120     marker->color[2]= color[2];
03121     marker->color[3]= color[3];
03122 
03123     for (tmp=text->markers.last; tmp; tmp=tmp->prev)
03124         if (tmp->lineno < marker->lineno || (tmp->lineno==marker->lineno && tmp->start < marker->start))
03125             break;
03126 
03127     if (tmp) BLI_insertlinkafter(&text->markers, tmp, marker);
03128     else BLI_addhead(&text->markers, marker);
03129 }
03130 
03131 /* Returns the first matching marker on the specified line between two points.
03132  * If the group or flags fields are non-zero the returned flag must be in the
03133  * specified group and have at least the specified flags set. */
03134 TextMarker *txt_find_marker_region(Text *text, TextLine *line, int start, int end, int group, int flags)
03135 {
03136     TextMarker *marker, *next;
03137     int lineno= txt_get_span(text->lines.first, line);
03138     
03139     for (marker=text->markers.first; marker; marker=next) {
03140         next= marker->next;
03141 
03142         if (group && marker->group != group) continue;
03143         else if ((marker->flags & flags) != flags) continue;
03144         else if (marker->lineno < lineno) continue;
03145         else if (marker->lineno > lineno) break;
03146 
03147         if ((marker->start==marker->end && start<=marker->start && marker->start<=end) ||
03148                 (marker->start<end && marker->end>start))
03149             return marker;
03150     }
03151     return NULL;
03152 }
03153 
03154 /* Clears all markers on the specified line between two points. If the group or
03155  * flags fields are non-zero the returned flag must be in the specified group
03156  * and have at least the specified flags set. */
03157 short txt_clear_marker_region(Text *text, TextLine *line, int start, int end, int group, int flags)
03158 {
03159     TextMarker *marker, *next;
03160     int lineno= txt_get_span(text->lines.first, line);
03161     short cleared= 0;
03162     
03163     for (marker=text->markers.first; marker; marker=next) {
03164         next= marker->next;
03165 
03166         if (group && marker->group != group) continue;
03167         else if ((marker->flags & flags) != flags) continue;
03168         else if (marker->lineno < lineno) continue;
03169         else if (marker->lineno > lineno) break;
03170 
03171         if ((marker->start==marker->end && start<=marker->start && marker->start<=end) ||
03172             (marker->start<end && marker->end>start)) {
03173             BLI_freelinkN(&text->markers, marker);
03174             cleared= 1;
03175         }
03176     }
03177     return cleared;
03178 }
03179 
03180 /* Clears all markers in the specified group (if given) with at least the
03181  * specified flags set. Useful for clearing temporary markers (group=0,
03182  * flags=TMARK_TEMP) */
03183 short txt_clear_markers(Text *text, int group, int flags)
03184 {
03185     TextMarker *marker, *next;
03186     short cleared= 0;
03187     
03188     for (marker=text->markers.first; marker; marker=next) {
03189         next= marker->next;
03190 
03191         if ((!group || marker->group==group) &&
03192                 (marker->flags & flags) == flags) {
03193             BLI_freelinkN(&text->markers, marker);
03194             cleared= 1;
03195         }
03196     }
03197     return cleared;
03198 }
03199 
03200 /* Finds the marker at the specified line and cursor position with at least the
03201  * specified flags set in the given group (if non-zero). */
03202 TextMarker *txt_find_marker(Text *text, TextLine *line, int curs, int group, int flags)
03203 {
03204     TextMarker *marker;
03205     int lineno= txt_get_span(text->lines.first, line);
03206     
03207     for (marker=text->markers.first; marker; marker=marker->next) {
03208         if (group && marker->group != group) continue;
03209         else if ((marker->flags & flags) != flags) continue;
03210         else if (marker->lineno < lineno) continue;
03211         else if (marker->lineno > lineno) break;
03212 
03213         if (marker->start <= curs && curs <= marker->end)
03214             return marker;
03215     }
03216     return NULL;
03217 }
03218 
03219 /* Finds the previous marker in the same group. If no other is found, the same
03220  * marker will be returned */
03221 TextMarker *txt_prev_marker(Text *text, TextMarker *marker)
03222 {
03223     TextMarker *tmp= marker;
03224     while (tmp) {
03225         if (tmp->prev) tmp= tmp->prev;
03226         else tmp= text->markers.last;
03227         if (tmp->group == marker->group)
03228             return tmp;
03229     }
03230     return NULL; /* Only if marker==NULL */
03231 }
03232 
03233 /* Finds the next marker in the same group. If no other is found, the same
03234  * marker will be returned */
03235 TextMarker *txt_next_marker(Text *text, TextMarker *marker)
03236 {
03237     TextMarker *tmp= marker;
03238     while (tmp) {
03239         if (tmp->next) tmp= tmp->next;
03240         else tmp= text->markers.first;
03241         if (tmp->group == marker->group)
03242             return tmp;
03243     }
03244     return NULL; /* Only if marker==NULL */
03245 }
03246 
03247 
03248 /*******************************/
03249 /* Character utility functions */
03250 /*******************************/
03251 
03252 int text_check_bracket(const char ch)
03253 {
03254     int a;
03255     char opens[] = "([{";
03256     char close[] = ")]}";
03257 
03258     for (a=0; a<(sizeof(opens)-1); a++) {
03259         if (ch==opens[a])
03260             return a+1;
03261         else if (ch==close[a])
03262             return -(a+1);
03263     }
03264     return 0;
03265 }
03266 
03267 /* TODO, have a function for operators - http://docs.python.org/py3k/reference/lexical_analysis.html#operators */
03268 int text_check_delim(const char ch)
03269 {
03270     int a;
03271     char delims[] = "():\"\' ~!%^&*-+=[]{};/<>|.#\t,@";
03272 
03273     for (a=0; a<(sizeof(delims)-1); a++) {
03274         if (ch==delims[a])
03275             return 1;
03276     }
03277     return 0;
03278 }
03279 
03280 int text_check_digit(const char ch)
03281 {
03282     if (ch < '0') return 0;
03283     if (ch <= '9') return 1;
03284     return 0;
03285 }
03286 
03287 int text_check_identifier(const char ch)
03288 {
03289     if (ch < '0') return 0;
03290     if (ch <= '9') return 1;
03291     if (ch < 'A') return 0;
03292     if (ch <= 'Z' || ch == '_') return 1;
03293     if (ch < 'a') return 0;
03294     if (ch <= 'z') return 1;
03295     return 0;
03296 }
03297 
03298 int text_check_whitespace(const char ch)
03299 {
03300     if (ch == ' ' || ch == '\t' || ch == '\r' || ch == '\n')
03301         return 1;
03302     return 0;
03303 }
